I don't know whether to make this an open letter to Becks or to explain my feelings about a song. Both get the job done. I think i will do the open letter later. Right now, i need music.

The first song is John Mayer's "I Don't Trust Myself (With Loving You)". I heard it again last night (early morning really) on Austin City Limits. I only watched it for him and his soulfulness. And my gosh is he amazing. People say he's a douche bag in disguise...i guess that's why i like him so much *eh*. Anyways, he played this song and the lyrics spoke to me (again). I had previously wasted the emotion of this song on Cheese. Now i waste it on Becks (haha...)

Since its late, i won't go into a line by line breakdown of why the song is pertinent. So i will be forced to be general...and concise...

The song bounces from general statements that ring true to what i would say/ my point of view. When Mayer says "hold on to whatever you find baby, hold on to whatever will get you through, hold on to whatever you find baby, I don't trust myself with loving you", it is me telling Becks to hold on to the one he loves because i don't think i would be a better option/replacement. I would like to think that who he's with is crap and that i would "treat him better" and "if he would only give me a chance" blah blah blah. I am kidding myself. How can EYE give someone the love and attention they deserve when i can barely love myself? I think that's the key to this whole thing, i have to start loving myself again and stop wishing others will fill a void only i can fill myself.

"I will beg my way into your garden, and then i will break my out when it rains, just to get back to a place where i started, so i can want you back all over again, (i don't really understand)"
     This is so true. And very typical of me (and very Geoff-like). I will feverishly try to get you and then when i have you, i won't want you anymore and figure out a way to leave. And then when you're gone, i'll miss you and want you back. It's really annoying and mean. I don't like that i do it. But its something i "can't help". I like the chase, a lot. So when that's over, you lose your luster. And i DON'T want to do that to Becks. I feel he deserves more than that, more than being a shiny toy at christmas. And the fact that i can't promise that won't happen, that i won't "love him and leave him", upsets and saddens me.

"Who do you love?...Me or the thought of me?"
     These questions are directed at me. I don't know who i love. Becks or the THOUGHT of Becks. Sadly i can answer that, the thought of him. I don't know him well. You can't know a person based on one-sided information. It doesn't work like that (to me). You have to be able to interact with them or you start to conjure up false hope. In my head, i have an IDEA of what Becks is like, who he is. But that doesn't mean it IS who he is. People can paint a picture of themselves that is entirely different from the real thing. Call me cynical, but for the most part it's true (haha). I trust that what he tells me is the truth, i mean why lie? But i need to be careful (personally) because i have a wicked imagination that can get away from me at times. I make people up to what i would like them to be in my head. So whenever i come across the real thing, i am sadly disappointed. And i have held Becks in such a "high" esteem that i don't want to see my mirror shattered....

Thus i don't trust myself loving him. So badly do i think i can, that once i get in it that i'll put my whole heart into it because he deserves someone who will...but i don't know. I have to constantly hesitate and beware b/c right now it is impossible (another reason why i should just stop talking to him altogether). But i'm trying to have this "hope" and "faith" he keeps going on about so who knows.

But that leads into the second song which is Paramore's "I Caught Myself"

This is a new find (like brand spanking lol). It illustrates the hesitation i must have in order to avoid screwing things up too much.

"Now when i caught myself, i had to stop myself, from saying something that i should have never thought of you....Don't know what i want, but i know its not you, keep pushing and pulling me down, but i know in my heart it's not you"
     I constantly have to keep myself from slipping it seems. We have such good convos. and like a girl, i drop subtle hints that i think are as clear as day, but of course i pride myself in being ultra vague. I should not be thinking we could be together, so i have to stop myself sometimes from hinting or alluding to such things. (its not THAT constant, i do have willpower for gosh sakes lol but sometimes he just gives me such "good" opportunities). I don't know what i want, and im like 80% sure its not him at all. We want different things in life and we are focused enough to actually go after those passions. Can 2 ppl in different directions meet up in the middle? sure, i never said an us was impossible, but right now we're not meeting and i know in my hear that its time for me to move on and forget this. Especially since i do want him to be happy and i doubt he would be happy w/ me. Too bad my insecurities get the best of me everytime...
